column1: On [[5 August]] [[1957]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
column2: two letters]] to Jerome W. Archer''', Director of Libraries at [[Marquette University]].<ref name=CG>{{CG
column6: articlename=J.R.R. Tolkien Collection: Other Tolkien Writings, 1911-1976

column1: *'''Subject:''' Discussion of the invitation to visit the Marquette University the following spring.<ref name=CG/><ref name=Marq/>
*'''Publication:''' A description of the letters, and quotation from the second letter, appeared in ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide
column2: The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology]]''.

Continuous over-work since 1951 has begun to tell on me; and I am feeling rather exhausted. I have recently been ill; and I am obliged to cancel plans travel this vacation. [...] Leave of absence will, however, I hope, enable me to clear off before next spring some of the things that are now harassing me; and I am now making preliminary plans for the use of the time, and am trying to fix some dates.
column3: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], Second letter to Jerome W. Archer (5 August 1957)}}
